definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: To me, in the love of the river, I often feel like I was upstream .
sentences.chinese: 於我，在愛情的河流裏，我經常覺得自己在逆流而上。

sentences.english: Eat fat food less, no-noSmokeWine, answer to often maintain defecate unobstructed .
sentences.chinese: 少喫油膩食物，禁忌菸酒，並應經常保持大便通暢。

sentences.english: He always cheats others, thus none of us trust him.
sentences.chinese: 他經常唬人，因此大家都不信任他。

sentences.english: This usually occurs during failure scenarios or periods of high load.
sentences.chinese: 這種景象經常產生在體系故障或者是高負荷的景象下。

sentences.english: And in the case of women, that often included sexual assault.
sentences.chinese: 如果女囚，還經常涉及到性侵犯。

sentences.english: We're finding that businesses who have bedbugs oftentimes will close to remediate the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現，經常鬧臭蟲的企業得歇業來處理這個問題。

sentences.english: As the lack of understanding of the disease, it's often misdiagnosed or missed diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 由於對該疾病認識的不足，經常被誤診或者漏診。

sentences.english: I must ask you to still visit with me. My feelings inside do not change.
sentences.chinese: 我求你一定要經常看望我，我內心的感情沒有變。

sentences.english: They should always be examined carefully.
sentences.chinese: 你應該經常小心地做好檢查。

sentences.english: Summer afternoons are frequently accompanied by thunderstorms.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的午後經常伴有雷暴雨。

sentences.english: During the war, our army often used letters attached with a chicken feather to deliver important messages.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭時期我軍經常用雞毛信傳遞重要信息。

sentences.english: In this movie we often pay attention to a vocabulary of "institutionalized".
sentences.chinese: 在這個影片裏我經常注意的一個詞“體制化”。

sentences.english: I often play puzzles and Legos at home.
sentences.chinese: 我經常在家玩猜謎遊戲和玩積木。

sentences.english: The New Age person often prefers a direct spiritual experience rather than one from organized religion.
sentences.chinese: 新時代人經常寧愛直接的靈性體驗勝過有組織的宗教。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
every kind of/all kinds of/various kinds
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
this/this kind of/this sort of/this type of
